newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka says '96 GDP growth at 3.7 percent.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka says '96 GDP growth at 3.7 percent.

text.p: Sri Lankan Deputy Finance Minister G.L. Peiris said on Wednesday the government expects to end 1996 with 3.7 percent gross domestic product (GDP) growth, down from the 5.5 percent increase last year.
"The Sri Lankan economy is expected to show a growth rate of 3.7 pct this year," Peiris told parliament as he presented the government budget for calendar 1997.

Peiris said in a speech that 1996 was "a difficult year with escalating military spending, a drought of exceptional severity and a resultant power shortage which led to a downturn in industrial production."
